column1:
## Reason of admission
69 years old man who came in on the 2024-01-08 with a alot swollen right leg since three days. Patient noticed progress of swelling and appearance of redness on day 3. Same day also shortness of breath. Temp 36 degrees Celsius. 

## Medical history
Hypertension, diabetes mellitus type 2, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease

## Hospital course
On examination extremely swollen right leg, with a bit of redness and pain when palpated. CRP 13. Leukocytes 8,2. D-dimer 23.4 mg/l. P-Creatinine 137. SpO2 82%. Started Eliquis 5 mg x 1 per os for suspected deep vein thrombosis. The patient underwent an ultrasound examination of the right leg which showed signs of DVT, as well as a CT of the lungs which showed pulmonary embolisms. Patient recieved oxygen and was able to mobilise. No fever. No pain. SpO2 92%, D-dimer normalized. Ward nurse informed patients wife and planned for transporatation home on 2024-01-11. 

## Medications
    Amlodipin (Amlodipine), 5 mg 1+0+0
    Losartan (Losartan), 50 mg 1+0+0
    Metformin (Metformin), 500 mg 2+0+2
    Eliquis (Apixaban),5mg 1+0+0, 6 months

## Procedures 
  None

## Plan after discharge
Oral anticoagulation treatment. Follow-up at the coagulation clinic, suspected hereditary coagulationdisease. 

## Secondary diagnosis
-     Hypertension
-     Diabetes mellitus type 2
-     Chronic kidney disease stage 3

## Main diagnosis (name and ICD code)
I80.1 Phlebitis and thrombophlebitis of femoral vein
I26.9 Pulmonary embolism without mention of acute cor pulmonale
